body: LEAD: To the Editor: To the Editor: Samuel A. Bogen (letter, Dec. 9) writes of subway trains he saw in Hong Kong with flexible sleevelike connections between cars. The New York subway system once had similar cars. These were articulated subway trains that ran on the Brighton Beach, West End and Sea Beach lines in Brooklyn into the Broadway-BMT
title: New York Had Them

body: LEAD: An article last Sunday on the Brighton Beach section of Brooklyn, home to many Soviet emigres, incorrectly located the Ukrainian city of Odessa. body: LEAD: New York is a city of many wondrous things. It is a city where an all-Japanese band plays tangos and where Asian Indians run Mexican restaurants. title: THE TALK OF BRIGHTON BEACH; A Stop on the D Train: Sand, Sea and Handball

body: LEAD: On the boardwalk in the 1940's, dancers did the Lindy to music from a juke box in front of ''Meyer's Knishes.''
